{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources (HR) Volunteer",
  "description": "Domeo Resources International (DRI) is a prolific organisation which proffers HR and Management Consultancy solutions premised on excellence and innovation. DRI analyses various organisational problems, develops improvement plans, deploys those plans and monitors the plans to ensure improved organisational performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources (HR) Volunteer

Job Location:&nbsp;&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Direct Reports: None
Reports to: HR Manager

Main Function


	The HR Volunteer will provide support to the HR team in implementing day-to-day human resources activities within the consulting firm.
	This role is ideal for an early-career professional seeking to gain practical experience in recruitment, employee engagement, performance management, and HR administration.
	The volunteer must bring at least 2 years of HR experience and a passion for developing skills within a consulting environment.


Role Responsibilities
Recruitment and Selection Support:


	Assist with posting job vacancies, reviewing applications, and shortlisting candidates.
	Coordinate virtual interviews and support onboarding processes for new hires.


HR Administration and Documentation:


	Maintain accurate digital records of staff files and HR databases.
	Assist with preparation of HR reports and documentation for management.


Employee Relations and Engagement:


	Support communication between HR and employees to ensure smooth remote operations.
	Assist in organising staff engagement and welfare initiatives.


Performance and Training Support:


	Contribute to the coordination of appraisal processes and performance management activities.
	Help identify training opportunities and assist with virtual learning programmes.


Policy and Compliance Support:


	Support the implementation of HR policies and ensure alignment with labour regulations.
	Assist in drafting and updating HR documentation where required.


General Support:


	Provide administrative and operational support to the HR team on assigned tasks.
	Contribute ideas to improve HR processes and employee experience.


Qualifications and Requirements
Education and Certifications:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resources Management, Industrial Relations, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Entry-level HR certification (CIPM Associate, SHRM, etc.) is an advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 2 years of HR experience, preferably in a consulting or service-oriented environment.


Skills:
HR Knowledge and Technical Skills:


	Basic knowledge of recruitment, employee relations, and performance management.
	Familiarity with HR systems, digital collaboration tools, and Microsoft Office Suite.


Communication and Interpersonal Skills:


	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Ability to collaborate remotely and build strong working relationships.


Organizational and Administrative Skills:


	Detail-oriented with strong multitasking and time management skills.
	Capable of maintaining accurate digital records and producing reports.


Professionalism and Initiative:


	Strong ethical standards, confidentiality, and integrity.
	Proactive, willing to learn, and able to work independently with minimal supervision.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letters to:&nbsp;recruitment@domeoresources.org&nbsp;using &ldquo;HR Volunteer (Abuja)&rdquo; as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-19",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-27",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Domeo Resources International"
    
  },

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

    }

Human Resources (HR) Volunteer Job at Domeo Resources International




        
    

        
        Domeo Resources International (DRI) is a prolific organisation which proffers HR and Management Consultancy solutions premised on excellence and innovation. DRI analyses various organisational problems, develops improvement plans, deploys those plans and monitors the plans to ensure improved organisational performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources (HR) Volunteer

Job Location:  Abuja (FCT) 
Direct Reports: None
Reports to: HR Manager

Main Function
     

            
    




	The HR Volunteer will provide support to the HR team in implementing day-to-day human resources activities within the consulting firm.
	This role is ideal for an early-career professional seeking to gain practical experience in recruitment, employee engagement, performance management, and HR administration.
	The volunteer must bring at least 2 years of HR experience and a passion for developing skills within a consulting environment.


Role Responsibilities
Recruitment and Selection Support:


	Assist with posting job vacancies, reviewing applications, and shortlisting candidates.
	Coordinate virtual interviews and support onboarding processes for new hires.


HR Administration and Documentation:


	Maintain accurate digital records of staff files and HR databases.
	Assist with preparation of HR reports and documentation for management.


Employee Relations and Engagement:


	Support communication between HR and employees to ensure smooth remote operations.
	Assist in organising staff engagement and welfare initiatives.


Performance and Training Support:


	Contribute to the coordination of appraisal processes and performance management activities.
	Help identify training opportunities and assist with virtual learning programmes.


Policy and Compliance Support:


	Support the implementation of HR policies and ensure alignment with labour regulations.
	Assist in drafting and updating HR documentation where required.


General Support:


	Provide administrative and operational support to the HR team on assigned tasks.
	Contribute ideas to improve HR processes and employee experience.


Qualifications and Requirements
Education and Certifications:


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources Management, Industrial Relations, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Entry-level HR certification (CIPM Associate, SHRM, etc.) is an advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 2 years of HR experience, preferably in a consulting or service-oriented environment.


Skills:
HR Knowledge and Technical Skills:


	Basic knowledge of recruitment, employee relations, and performance management.
	Familiarity with HR systems, digital collaboration tools, and Microsoft Office Suite.


Communication and Interpersonal Skills:


	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Ability to collaborate remotely and build strong working relationships.


Organizational and Administrative Skills:


	Detail-oriented with strong multitasking and time management skills.
	Capable of maintaining accurate digital records and producing reports.


Professionalism and Initiative:


	Strong ethical standards, confidentiality, and integrity.
	Proactive, willing to learn, and able to work independently with minimal supervision.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letters to: recruitment@domeoresources.org using “HR Volunteer (Abuja)” as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HMO Provider Management Officer",
  "description": "Fort Knox Outsourcing is poised to serve the growing need of businesses in Nigeria.&nbsp;By helping them to reap the economic, strategic and operational benefits offered by outsourcing.&nbsp;We act as a &ldquo;Third Party Service Provider&rdquo; that Source, Select, and Second employment ready workforce in line with client specifications to meet their talent needs as quickly as possible!.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HMO Provider Management Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ojota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Manage and maintain relationships with healthcare providers within the HMO network.
	Conduct provider onboarding, credentialing, and periodic re-credentialing.
	Monitor provider performance, service quality, and adherence to HMO policies and SLAs.
	Handle provider complaints, escalations, and resolution of service-related issues.
	Negotiate provider contracts, tariffs, and service agreements in line with company policies.
	Carry out regular provider visits, audits, and assessments across Lagos.
	Review and validate provider bills, utilization reports, and service delivery records.
	Collaborate with internal teams (Claims, Medical, Customer Service) to ensure seamless service delivery.
	Maintain accurate provider records and generate periodic management reports.
	Ensure compliance with NHIA (formerly NHIS) and other regulatory requirements.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Health Administration, Medical Sciences, Nursing, Public Health, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 - 4 years of experience in an HMO, healthcare facility, or provider management role.
	Strong understanding of HMO operations and healthcare provider networks.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship management skills.
	Ability to analyze data, prepare reports, and manage multiple providers effectively.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and healthcare management systems.
	Knowledge of healthcare regulations and standards in Nigeria is an added advantage.


Salary
N300,000 Monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@fortknoxoutsourcing.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&ldquo;HMO Provider Management Officer &ndash; Lagos&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "FORT KNOX OUTSOURCING"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

HMO Provider Management Officer Job at Fort Knox Outsourcing




        
    

        
        Fort Knox Outsourcing is poised to serve the growing need of businesses in Nigeria. By helping them to reap the economic, strategic and operational benefits offered by outsourcing. We act as a “Third Party Service Provider” that Source, Select, and Second employment ready workforce in line with client specifications to meet their talent needs as quickly as possible!.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HMO Provider Management Officer

Job Location: Ojota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage and maintain relationships with healthcare providers within the HMO network.
	Conduct provider onboarding, credentialing, and periodic re-credentialing.
	Monitor provider performance, service quality, and adherence to HMO policies and SLAs.
	Handle provider complaints, escalations, and resolution of service-related issues.
	Negotiate provider contracts, tariffs, and service agreements in line with company policies.
	Carry out regular provider visits, audits, and assessments across Lagos.
	Review and validate provider bills, utilization reports, and service delivery records.
	Collaborate with internal teams (Claims, Medical, Customer Service) to ensure seamless service delivery.
	Maintain accurate provider records and generate periodic management reports.
	Ensure compliance with NHIA (formerly NHIS) and other regulatory requirements.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Health Administration, Medical Sciences, Nursing, Public Health, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 - 4 years of experience in an HMO, healthcare facility, or provider management role.
	Strong understanding of HMO operations and healthcare provider networks.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship management skills.
	Ability to analyze data, prepare reports, and manage multiple providers effectively.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and healthcare management systems.
	Knowledge of healthcare regulations and standards in Nigeria is an added advantage.


Salary
N300,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@fortknoxoutsourcing.com using “HMO Provider Management Officer – Lagos” as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Audit Assistant Job at Bukka Hut Restaurant




        
    

        
        Bukka Hut Restaurant is a fast-growing organization with almost 20 outlets in Lagos and care greatly about our staff. Beyond hospitality, Bukka Hut thrives as a people-centric brand with a laser focus on championing people empowerment initiatives. We like to view our business sectors as channels used to transform the lives of our stakeholders. This stems from our internal workforce to the community we operate in.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Audit Assistant

Job Location: Osolo / Festac / Anthony - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Main Duties
     

            
    




	Collect and organize financial documents (invoices, receipts, statements).
	Check if numbers are correct and match the company’s records.
	Help test how well the company’s internal controls work.
	Write down findings and prepare simple reports.
	Ask departments or clients for information when needed.
	Keep all information confidential.


Qualifications


	A Degree or Diploma in Accounting, Finance, or something similar.
	Some experience or internship in accounting (optional but helpful).


Skills Needed:


	Basic knowledge of accounting.
	Good with numbers and details.
	Able to use Excel and other computer tools.
	Good communication and teamwork.
	Willing to learn and follow instructions.


Salary
N80,000 - N89,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: godwinabah@bukkahut.com using "Audit Assistant" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Canva Course Instructor (Recorded Sessions)",
  "description": "Raphael Group is a professional virtual assistant service that connects employers with skilled remote assistants. We offer a wide range of services to support individuals and businesses, including scheduling, email management, research, and more. We take the hassle out of finding and hiring qualified virtual assistants, allowing you to focus on growing your business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Canva Course Instructor (Recorded Sessions)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Contract
Work Schedule: Remote

Job Overview


	We need a Course Instructor who can deliver clear, practical recorded lessons focused on Canva.
	You must know Canva inside out, design basics, branding, templates, presentations, social media graphics, animations, and real-world workflows.
	If you&rsquo;re confident on camera, can explain design concepts in simple steps, and can teach a diverse audience, this role is for you.
	Your job is to record structured, high-quality sessions that follow our curriculum and meet professional instructional standards.


About the Role


	Teach Canva from beginner to advanced levels.
	Record polished, easy-to-follow lessons with strong audio and visual clarity.
	Break down design principles, layout, color, typography, hierarchy, into simple, actionable steps.
	Demonstrate real use-cases: social media content, brand kits, presentations, marketing materials, templates.
	Use screen-recording tools to deliver clean, step-by-step walkthroughs.
	Follow the course outline provided by the curriculum team.
	Maintain consistent pacing, tone, and instructional quality across all recordings.
	Re-record or refine segments to improve clarity, accuracy, or flow.
	Include practical exercises&mdash;design challenges, template tasks, mini-projects, redesign activities.
	Ensure each lesson meets instructional best practices and is easy for all skill levels to follow.
	Anticipate common learner mistakes and address them proactively.
	Communicate clearly without overcomplicating design concepts.
	Offer optional live clarification sessions if required.
	Suggest improvements to course structure and learner experience.
	Meet all recording, content update, and delivery deadlines.


Requirements


	Preferably based in Lagos State.
	Must have the right recording setup:
	Noise-free environment
	Functional laptop
	Stable internet
	Comfortable workstation
	Strong expertise in Canva&mdash;design, templates, branding, animation, and workflow.
	Previous experience teaching or recording training sessions (minimum one sample required).
	Confident on camera with clear communication and good presentation skills.
	Ability to teach learners from different cultures, backgrounds, and skill levels.
	Proficient with tools like Loom, Zoom, OBS, Camtasia, or similar recording platforms.
	Organized, detail-oriented, and capable of producing high-quality lessons independently.
	Applications without video samples will not be reviewed.


Salary
N150,000 / month.

Application Requirement


	All applicants must submit at least one video sample demonstrating previous teaching or training experience&mdash;preferably Canva-related.

  "datePosted": "2025-12-19",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

Canva Course Instructor (Recorded Sessions) Job at Raphael Group




        
    

        
        Raphael Group is a professional virtual assistant service that connects employers with skilled remote assistants. We offer a wide range of services to support individuals and businesses, including scheduling, email management, research, and more. We take the hassle out of finding and hiring qualified virtual assistants, allowing you to focus on growing your business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Canva Course Instructor (Recorded Sessions)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract
Work Schedule: Remote

Job Overview
     

            
    




	We need a Course Instructor who can deliver clear, practical recorded lessons focused on Canva.
	You must know Canva inside out, design basics, branding, templates, presentations, social media graphics, animations, and real-world workflows.
	If you’re confident on camera, can explain design concepts in simple steps, and can teach a diverse audience, this role is for you.
	Your job is to record structured, high-quality sessions that follow our curriculum and meet professional instructional standards.


About the Role


	Teach Canva from beginner to advanced levels.
	Record polished, easy-to-follow lessons with strong audio and visual clarity.
	Break down design principles, layout, color, typography, hierarchy, into simple, actionable steps.
	Demonstrate real use-cases: social media content, brand kits, presentations, marketing materials, templates.
	Use screen-recording tools to deliver clean, step-by-step walkthroughs.
	Follow the course outline provided by the curriculum team.
	Maintain consistent pacing, tone, and instructional quality across all recordings.
	Re-record or refine segments to improve clarity, accuracy, or flow.
	Include practical exercises—design challenges, template tasks, mini-projects, redesign activities.
	Ensure each lesson meets instructional best practices and is easy for all skill levels to follow.
	Anticipate common learner mistakes and address them proactively.
	Communicate clearly without overcomplicating design concepts.
	Offer optional live clarification sessions if required.
	Suggest improvements to course structure and learner experience.
	Meet all recording, content update, and delivery deadlines.


Requirements


	Preferably based in Lagos State.
	Must have the right recording setup:
	Noise-free environment
	Functional laptop
	Stable internet
	Comfortable workstation
	Strong expertise in Canva—design, templates, branding, animation, and workflow.
	Previous experience teaching or recording training sessions (minimum one sample required).
	Confident on camera with clear communication and good presentation skills.
	Ability to teach learners from different cultures, backgrounds, and skill levels.
	Proficient with tools like Loom, Zoom, OBS, Camtasia, or similar recording platforms.
	Organized, detail-oriented, and capable of producing high-quality lessons independently.
	Applications without video samples will not be reviewed.


Salary
N150,000 / month.

Application Requirement


	All applicants must submit at least one video sample demonstrating previous teaching or training experience—preferably Canva-related.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: HR Officer Job at Future Moves Recruitment Agency Limited
content:
Future Moves Recruitment Agency Limited (FMR Agency) is a licensed full-fledged human resource and management consulting company.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Officer

Job Location: Satelite Town, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Monday - Saturday)

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced HR Officer to support daily HR operations. T
	he ideal candidate will bring strong expertise in HR strategy, employee relations, and compliance, with a proven ability to support organizational growth and maintain a positive work culture.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Oversee the full spectrum of HR functions including recruitment, onboarding, performance management, training, and employee relations.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, company policies, and industry regulations.
	Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with business goals.
	Manage disciplinary processes, conflict resolution, and grievance handling.
	Lead initiatives to improve employee engagement and retention.
	Maintain accurate HR records and reports.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related fields (Master’s Degree is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 5 years of proven HR management experience.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor laws and HR best practices.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills.
	Experience in the pharmaceutical industry is an advantage.
	Male candidates are preferable for gender balance.
	Only applicants residing close to the location will be contacted.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruiter.b@fmragency.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
